title: China has relaxed its visa rules – here's everything you need to know about visiting the country
text:
There was good news this week for Britons hoping to visit China, with new entry rules meaning more of the country can be visited without a visa.

From December 1, residents of 53 countries – including the UK – will be able to visit 20 cities (up from the existing 15) for up to six days without applying in advance.

The new options include Chongqing, a rapidly growing citiy at the confluence of the Yangtze and Jialing rivers, and Xi’an, famed for its terracotta warriors.

However, travellers need to be transiting through China, and have proof of onward travel to a third country (this can include Hong Kong and Macau), to take advantage.
